content.question: Which of the following is a way Congress can influence the federal judiciary?

choices.label: It can filibuster decisions made by courts.
It can change appellate jurisdiction of federal courts.
It can review federal judges for reappointment every ten years.
It can exercise oversight authority over rulings of individual justices.

content.answer: It can change appellate jurisdiction of federal courts.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
